channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

item.title: Report E-2024010118
item.description:
Report E-2024010118

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-06
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a release from 24 boxes of UN1824 Mechanical Warewash Detergent each containing 1.5-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete spill cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2.5-gallons of product released in total to a 6’ x 12’ area of the trailer floor due to load shift/improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged boxes of product were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package while being loaded was found to be damage due to a leak which QA was called to retrieve the package and place it in the hazmat area to be inspected and processed DescribePack: While package was being inspected the bottles inside didn't had any punctured or crack damage that was causing the leak but the caps were loose which was being loaded caused the leak inside DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: QA was called right away with absorbing pads to carefully clean the affected areas where the package was being loaded to and taken in a tote container to the hazmat area

item.title: Report E-2024010002
item.description:
Report E-2024010002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-26
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 26, 2023, six (6) one-gallon pails of UN1789 released approximately two (2) gallons of product due to loose lids. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized absorbent pads and a neutralizing solution to wipe down the impacted freight and dock floor. One (1) vented 30-gallon drum of the six (6) damaged 1-gallon plastic jugs and two (2) 55-gallon drums of impacted pads, the cut-up pallet, and any cleanup debris were generated as waste and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report X-2023120210
item.description:
Report X-2023120210

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: BARSTOW
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/22/23, the UTLX 205951 was found in the Barstow railyard to be leaking methanol from the top of the car. Hazmat responders isolated the car and the inspection revealed liquid leaking through the packing stem. The valve was found in the partially open position and was missing the packing retainer nut. The valve and release were secured with a pin. On 11/30/23, Graymar Env returned to further secure the valve by adding a packing sleeve and retainer nut. The car was pressure tested to verify integrity of repairs. No leaks were found. Shipper advised of need to get OTMA for movement to destination.
